website_summaries.verdict: An easy to store 36-piece stamp set that makes a quality imprint on metals, leather, and wood.
pros: Plastic container is compact and ideal for storage
Letters press into various soft metals with ease and are legible
Stamps are sturdy and made to withstand many hammer hits
Each stamp is coated in oil to avoid rusting
cons: Protective oil coating has a strong odor

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing stamps! I tried out a few, and each one was easily legible. For the money, you can't beat these. I would definitely recommend them. They did have some type of oil or grease on them. But it didn't rub off on my hands or my items. It just had the strong odor. (Which is not an issue for me). Also note* I haven't tried these on hard metal items. So far, I've just stamped on the softer metals.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: very nice set .ive only use it on aluminum but it leaves a nice crisp letter . only drawback is there's no marking on the sides to show which way the letters should face. hard to tell because of color. i'll make a markon the right side with paint so i don't stamp one wrong side up. minor problem easy fix but other than that a great set
customer_reviews.author: walter

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed for my trailer
customer_reviews.text: I had to punch a VIN on a trailer I built. Did the job perfectly! These come coated with oil so be careful handling it (they are slippery and can be messy the first time). I found it easy to clamp some straight pieces of scrap wood on the surface to build a guide for the punches to line up correctly. It’s important to hold the punch PERPENDICULAR to the surface to get an even punch without risking it moving off course. Just a slight tap with a 16 oz hammer does the trick
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Works on Steel
customer_reviews.text: This punch set worked as expected. Used it to punch the vehicle identification number (VIN) on the steel frame of my RV. Used a strip of masking tape for alignment. Would buy it again for this purpose without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sized letters
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect for stamping copper signs for my herb garden. I'm sure I will find other uses in the future. They are very well constructed and a decent size. I didn't want letters that were so small they are hard to read.
customer_reviews.author: Jacques

customer_reviews.title: Excellent punch set
customer_reviews.text: There are great for using to put initials, etc on my woodworking projects. They work especially well on harder woods. It's a perfect size also. I have some smaller ones that are good for the smallest projects but they are harder to read than these.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas McCain

customer_reviews.title: Nice! Great price!
customer_reviews.text: Nice inexpensive set. Light oil coating, to be expected. Used on aluminum and worked great. Seem to be pretty hard metal, hammer didnt make a mark on the upper end so I am thinking these would work fine on soft steel. Nice enough case, easy enough to make a wood rack if you want to spread out and organize. Satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: KIM@MTV

customer_reviews.title: Okay for Softer Metal
customer_reviews.text: Some are not lined up straight with the square portion of the set, which makes them less than perfect, and for some reason, the "X" just wouldn't imprint well at all. I was using them to put the VIN on a canoe trailer, though, so they might work better on softer metals (suspect they would). Also, the case came with a huge crack in it that split in half when I set it down while using them. Case is junk.
customer_reviews.author: LucyLu

customer_reviews.title: A good set
customer_reviews.text: These punches are heavy duty for their size. I made a heavy strike using two different ones with no damage to the punches. The imprints were very good as well. This is a good set to pick up for your toolbox especially for 16 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Talos656

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: I used these for pottery and really liked them. Would work well for jewelry too, which is probably the intended purpose. Some of the letters are just slightly cut off, but I didn't think it was that big of a deal. I also didn't have problems with rusting, but other people sometimes put oil on them. Definitely high quality. Could probably use these for a lot of different things because they are so high quality. Good for crafting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very handy
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for making permanent tags for garden plants. I used them on aluminum tags. Of course nothing is ever permanent in the garden, so some of the tags will become obsolete. I haven't tried pounding out one name on a tag so I could stamp another name, but I'm sure it will come to that.
customer_reviews.author: PMW

customer_reviews.title: Not a quality product at all, even at the fair price.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cheesy stamp set, even.at this price. Several stamos were off kilter, which causes a letter to be stamped more on one side than the other. All the heads were bulged out, which prevents stacking them to make a straight evenly soaced word or series of numbers. Do not recommend for anything you want to look like quality stamps were used. After much work on a grinder I manage to even.up the sides where they were bulged out, of course I cannot return them like this. I would have returned them but I needed to get stuff stamped before it sold.
customer_reviews.author: Optiman36

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Quality but Oily
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. Easily legible and comes in a nice hard plastic storage case. All of it seems to be of nice quality but all of the punches and the entire box is completely covered in machine oil. Not that big of a deal to wipe off- just annoying that oil was all over the place and wasn’t expecting that. Like so much that it ran out of the box all over the cardboard box it was packaged in. (Not the amazon shipping box though). Would be five stars otherwise. Absolutely the best bang for the buck if you’re looking for a punch letter set.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Great for wood part labeling
customer_reviews.text: Really useful for labeling wooden parts. I use this on my furniture projects when labeling doors, drawers, and various other parts as to not mix things up while finishing or painting. Leaves a decent, clear, deep mark. Quality control was lacking, got a couple duplicate letters, but returning for an exchange didn’t seem worth it since I needed it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse McKee

customer_reviews.title: My experience forming letters with this tool
customer_reviews.text: After calling my states Natural Resources Department for instructions I made a ID number plate for my boat which had lost it's. I used some sheet aluminum and stamped the letters and numbers on it. I used a 8 oz. ball peen hammer with the aluminum lying on solid heavy steel. The impressions on the metal are clear and well formed. This punch set appears to be of good quality and is most suitable for such applications.
customer_reviews.author: J Bird

customer_reviews.title: Work great on steel
customer_reviews.text: I had to re do the numbers on my boat trailer and these worked well. Its a little hard to keep them steady while hammering but that may be normal. They stamped well and did the job. The case they came in makes it easy to keep track of them. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Great for my propose, fishing stringers.
customer_reviews.text: I used these for making fishing stringers for my brother and myself to use on boats in Destin, Florida. These are very easy to use and it did take a few strikes to get the pressure just right, I used a 1 pound hammer. I also used tape as a guide to line the letters and numbers up. making a straight line. The stringers are made of aluminum bar stock.
customer_reviews.author: Miller Tyme

customer_reviews.title: Decent set of punches
customer_reviews.text: A decent set of punches. They aren't square so you have to kind of mess with them to make sure the punch ends up straight and the bottom side should have the letter punched in so you can just grab the punch and look at it before you hit the punch to make sure it's right.
customer_reviews.author: JCM

customer_reviews.title: Not for my purposes
customer_reviews.text: Was trying to use these to stamp “Restored from Salvage” on my car. The Metal is soft and that meant it started to make craters more than letters. Tried it on some hard metal and it worked great. But for this purpose, it wasn’t great. But hey, it worked!
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Riley

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Shipping Packaging Overkill
customer_reviews.text: Great item. Very heavy. Letters are nice and wide and easy to read when stamped in leather. We bought multiples of them and the packaging was a bit ridiculous and hard to get into. I thought to give 4 stars for this, but it does not effect the product.
customer_reviews.author: lori

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on any surface.
customer_reviews.text: These don't stamp any kind of metal. I tried using them on a variety of surfaces (pine, Douglas fir, steel, copper, aluminum, leather). They barely left any imprint. Awful product. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Qj22Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The packaging was less than desirable and it smelled like an auto shop when i opened it up
customer_reviews.text: The packaging was less than desirable and it smelled like an auto shop when i opened it up. They were covered in a weird grease that i had to wash off of the stamps before i could use them. HOWEVER use wise, they are decent stamps. Just what i needed and at the right price.
customer_reviews.author: SCHNEPF

customer_reviews.title: Great types, clear and clean impressions.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, the impression on wood is very good. I didn't think these would be too big, but the text comes out larger than I thought they would. I'm glad I did not get the larger version. I think these would be perfect for most use. I use these mostly for my wood working.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: They work.
customer_reviews.text: These are okay, about the same as I have found anywhere, but a better price than most. I stamped about 30 steel shot puts with the set and only chipped one of the punches so far.
customer_reviews.author: Montana Meeks

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but good.
customer_reviews.text: Just received yesterday. Tried this morning. So far the punches work well. Containers the punches come in are very cheap and was broken already when i opened the package. They should use a more durable container for the punches. And maybe hold back on the oil they put on the punches, it was a bit overkill. Guess we will see how well these punches hold up. Can't beat the price if the quality is there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made and as advertised. Some letters are just ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made and as advertised. Some letters are just a bit off of the vertical (-1 star) so you need to test them first on scrap material. I heated each punch with a propane torch (using vise-grips to hold it) to burn the letters in wood, worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Doug M.

customer_reviews.title: Lesson learned
customer_reviews.text: Letters were not Square with punch so if stamping multiple letters (initials in leather) at same time they would look like a ransom note. If doing individually you have to twist to ge them to appear straight. I just bought wrong tool for the job. For marking tools and using one at a time they would be adequate. For my use basically a lesson in buy the right tool.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Some stamps formed poorly
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used these yet but I'm already disappointed. There of the stamps have bumps on the stamping surface. I was going to use these for stamping sibgle repeatedly to make textures in jewelry metal and these were a couple a couple of the ones I was going to used. Bummed out.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: really hard to use. you have to hit it ...
customer_reviews.text: really hard to use. you have to hit it so hard you can damage what you are punching. Does not work at all on metal. Looks really bad
customer_reviews.author: mary a byerly

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: These work great for stamping leather. I haven't tried them on anything else, but I am happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lacey

customer_reviews.title: It met my expectations but could be made better by switching duplicate letters/numbers and substituting some more special ...
customer_reviews.text: This product was OK. It met my expectations but could be made better by switching duplicate letters/numbers and substituting some more special characters such as; @, #, $, %. Overall comment it is OK for the price. Works as advertised but could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for what I needed it for. Stamped ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for what I needed it for. Stamped my name on some brass tags for use at work. Stamped clear letters into brass. Don't know how it would work with harder metals.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Work great in aluminum for sure, some of the letters are not perfectly aligned
customer_reviews.text: Work great in aluminum for sure, some of the letters are not perfectly aligned, three in my case, so you have to be careful of that.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: There are better ones out there.
customer_reviews.text: The only real issue with these is that they are not orientated as to direction. So they cannot be used quickly. You need to pay attention to not punch them upside down.
customer_reviews.author: AverageConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Great letters numbers
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff did what I wanted it to do just nice reasonably priced arrived quick
customer_reviews.author: JCT

customer_reviews.title: Okay for very soft metal.
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality, but don't try to use them on anything harder than soft brass. They are much too soft to mark it and it will deform the letters on the tool. All in all, not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like the size. These stamps are not the easiest to use as they are not all straight.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hart

customer_reviews.title: ... sharp and require lots of force to get a good
customer_reviews.text: Do the job but not very sharp and require lots of force to get a good stamp
customer_reviews.author: samuel smith

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: These things are junk. Should've returned them when I had the chance.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Good punch set
customer_reviews.text: Used on an aluminum strip for boat identification tag. Worked well using a metal block as a base.
customer_reviews.author: ppbarnes

customer_reviews.title: Product works great. Love the compact small box doesn't take up ...
customer_reviews.text: Deliver was fast. Product works great. Love the compact small box doesn't take up a lot of space Punch comes out clean and clear
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: A nice set for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a punch set to label my plants copper stakes. This set worked well.
customer_reviews.author: photo geek

customer_reviews.title: Great and oily
customer_reviews.text: Oily when I opened them but a great set for the price and size. Very happy with my purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Not fit for purpose
customer_reviews.text: Letters are squint and some not properly formed. Total junk.
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: Not super clean and neat
customer_reviews.text: No great. Not super clean and neat, hard to use
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Damaged product case.
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived on time. But the case was cracked on 3out it 4 sides and the lid was cracked on 2 sides.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Everhart

customer_reviews.title: Good for metals like mild steel
customer_reviews.text: Stamped an ID number into my trailer frame. Everything worked good with no damage to the tools
customer_reviews.author: mike weaks

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are great but I think I bought pendants that were way to hard.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in every way.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used them yet but are perfect, size and quality for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jill B McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed, even bought different types of metal to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Not ideal for jewelry metal stamping. Only have of the letter shows up if that. Very disappointed, even bought different types of metal to use and none would work
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: received as promised and was exactly what I had expected.
customer_reviews.author: Saw Dust Farms

customer_reviews.title: Cracked box
customer_reviews.text: Excited to get these, the box came broken as did the lid on one side. There was a lot of packaging so maybe it was already broken before going in the mail?
customer_reviews.author: Ramon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Punch Set For Leather Labels
customer_reviews.text: This punch set worked great. It was just what I needed, they are sturdy, strong, and the letters are the perfect size for creating leather labels.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Covered in blue industrial grease
customer_reviews.text: I've never bought this type of leather stamps before, so I don't know what the standard is, but this set was covered in blue grease. I washed them all and wiped throughly before using it on a piece of veg tan leather, but still stained the leather from the residue grease between the letter. But after a few rounds, it goes away.
customer_reviews.author: Rie Taniuchi

customer_reviews.title: I didn't like the style of the #'s/letters
customer_reviews.text: Can only use on soft metal. I didn't like the style of the #'s/letters.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine C.

customer_reviews.title: Case stains, punches are good
customer_reviews.text: Mine came in a blue case. Oddly enough, the case stains, including the packaging it shipped in. So be careful what you leave it sitting on. But the punches themselves work well. I've used them only on wood but can't imagine them deforming or anything.
customer_reviews.author: BrandonTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: The punch set seems to be good quality. My problem is it was not packed ...
customer_reviews.text: The punch set seems to be good quality. My problem is it was not packed well for shipment. The case arrived smashed and not useable at all for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Winnie

customer_reviews.title: Seem to be well made, started using them right ...
customer_reviews.text: Seem to be well made, started using them right away and realized that my set came with 2 F's an no E's... had to return
customer_reviews.author: fred scaife

customer_reviews.title: Good, but hard to get individual punches out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Punches work great. Only complaint is that they are hard to get out of the box without a pair of tweezers.
customer_reviews.author: dboyt

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and price
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality, heavy and sturdy. Just wish the letter depth was deeper. Over all great product
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca G

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but takes a light touch to only ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but takes a light touch to only knock the desired character into the wood and not the round base of the punch.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: They do the job and are easy to use. Wish I could find larger ones for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: fiveclays

customer_reviews.title: They work fine for me
customer_reviews.text: I use them in my wood shop to mark parts and stamping my initials in Christmas ornaments. They work fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: HRW

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was the right size for the application I needed it for
customer_reviews.author: Beau Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works for me, just make sure to use a quality ball pein hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G

customer_reviews.title: Empty package
customer_reviews.text: I'd love to review this, however, it delivered today in a white bubble wrap envelope (first bad sign since this product is too large to fit in an envelope) and upon opening, it nothing was inside. Not even a packing slip
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but came out of the package oily
customer_reviews.text: Good quality but came out of the package oily? I love the font and size and they work super well, but I now have an oil splotch on my carpet from spilling these all on the floor when I opened them upside down lol
customer_reviews.author: Jacob DeChant

customer_reviews.title: and did not make good impressions. Sent it back
customer_reviews.text: covered in grease, smelled... and did not make good impressions. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Horton

customer_reviews.title: Letter are too big for 1-1/2 inch brass coin. ...
customer_reviews.text: Letter are too big for 1-1/2 inch brass coin. The letters seem too low to imprint into coin and the medal is covered in oil. Not sure if that's how they are suppose to be but I'm going to have to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Haven't had a chance to use this yet, looks ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to use this yet, looks well made but I think it may be slightly too big for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard surface only
customer_reviews.text: Nice box for presentation but you need a hard level surface to work on. Not your kitchen table or countertop. If done correctly the letters come out fine.
customer_reviews.author: newbie

customer_reviews.title: Not to goog
customer_reviews.text: I've held these with a pair of vice grips and het them with a two lb. hammer and they bearly put a dent in metal.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: nice letter and number set - no problems with any of the set I got
customer_reviews.author: BillB

product_meta.title: Vector Number & Capital Letter Punch Set 36 Pc (6mm 1/4"): 09098
product_meta.description: Complete Set Of 36 Pieces Of Numbers And Letters In A Red Plastic Box. Letters A-z, Numbers 0-9, (the Six Can Be Inverted To Also Be A 9), And The "&" Symbol. Great For Personalization Of Jewelry And Other Metal Items For Identification.
feature_bullets: * A Well Made, Durable Set Of Stamps
* Compact size box, won't take up a lot of space
* Perfect for personalizing jewelry and other items

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars242 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
